meanings.sent1: The new law will legitimize the use of electric scooters on the sidewalks.
meanings.sent2: The government decided to legitimize the practice of recycling to protect the environment.
meanings.sent3: It would be quite amusing if a magic spell could legitimize all homework to be completed instantly.
meanings.sent4: Her signature on the contract seemed to legitimize the deal, making it official.
meanings.sent5: The golden seal on the document served to legitimize its authenticity.

meanings.definition: To give official approval or recognition to.
meanings.sent1: The mayor's presence at the event will legitimize its importance in the community.
meanings.sent2: The company's award will legitimize their position as a leader in the industry.
meanings.sent3: It would be amusing to see a robot legitimize a dance competition with its approval.
meanings.sent4: The celebrity endorsement helped legitimize the brand's reputation among consumers.
meanings.sent5: The royal decree served to legitimize the nobleman's claim to the estate.

meanings.sent1: His explanation did not legitimize his absence from the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The evidence presented was enough to legitimize their decision to move forward with the project.
meanings.sent3: It would be amusing to see someone try to legitimize eating ice cream for breakfast every day.
meanings.sent4: The heartfelt apology helped legitimize her actions and repair the relationship.
meanings.sent5: The success of the fundraiser legitimized the charity's mission to help those in need.
